title: Highest use of alternative and nuclear energy
description: In 2023, Iceland used alternative and nuclear energy for 89.33% of its total energy consumption, one of the highest percentages globally.

title: Highest electric power consumption per capita
description: In 2023, Iceland had an electric power consumption of 50,082.75 kWh per capita, the highest in the world.

title: Highest account ownership among adults
description: In 2021, 100% of Iceland's population aged 15 and above owned an account at a financial institution or with a mobile-money-service provider, including the poorest 40%, older adults, and those with secondary education or more.

title: Lowest carbon dioxide emissions from agriculture
description: In 2023, Iceland's carbon dioxide emissions from agriculture were only 0.0008 Mt CO2e, one of the lowest in the world.

title: Lowest share of youth not in education, employment, or training (female)
description: In 2023, only 2.619% of Icelandic female youth were not in education, employment, or training, the lowest percentage globally.

title: Lowest agricultural irrigated land
description: In 2021, only 0.0027% of Iceland's agricultural land was irrigated, the lowest percentage in the world.
